creator: christ1

content:
here is the info in brief steps:

  1. start thunderbird on old PC
  2. click tools>export and then click 'open profile folder'
  3. exit thunderbird
  4. copy contents of the profile folder.
  5. install thunderbird on new pc, downloaded from thunderbird.net
  6. in receiving PC, click help>troubleshootinginformation
  7. scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'
  8. exit thunderbird
  9. now, paste contents of windows profile, overlaying contents of profile.
  10. if there is a compatibilitie.ini file, delete it
  11. restart thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content:
Open compose window and in the formatting bar click on the (normally) black rectangle "Choose colour for text" (1) This opens the "Text colour" box. In this box click on the (normally) black rectangle "Choose a colour" (2) This will open a new window offering the choice between a certain number of text colours (3) Choose your text colour - it will immediately be displayed in the rectangle in the left box - then close the colour choice window with a click on the small red dot in the upper left corner before clicking on OK (4) Most people click OK immediately which doesn't save the colour choice...

Works here running macOS Monterey and TB 147
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Please post a screenshot of the error. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/how-do-i-create-screenshot-my-problem

Also, please post your Troubleshooting Information. At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button ≡, then select Help > Troubleshooting Information. Press the "Copy text to clipboard button" and paste the information into your reply.

content: Does this happen on all website links, or just this one?
creator: davidsk

content: Only on internal Thunderbird pages - no matter whether sent, received, spam etc.
creator: witoldrem

content:
See https://support.mozilla.org/kb/filelink-large-attachments

You need to fix your Filelink Provider account, or just remove it. This has got nothing to do with your email account.
creator: christ1

content:
Do I just do that by clicking on the + New Account button, please?

Yes. Note, Gmail uses OAuth authentication. You need to allow cookies in Thunderbird for the OAuth authentication to succeed.

I'd hate to lose access to my BT mail by doing that.

You won't.

Having said that, it is always a good idea to create backups of your Thunderbird profile on a regular basis. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_backing-up-a-profile
creator: christ1

content: Thunderbird 147.0 needs macOS 10.15 Catalina or later https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/147.0/system-requirements/ Either your Mac allows upgrade to Catalina or a more recent macOS version or you have to download TB 115.9.0 from https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.9.0/mac/ and install it on your Mac
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Try these steps::

  1. start thunderbird on old PC
  2. click tools>export and then click 'open profile folder'
  3. exit thunderbird
  4. copy profile content to external media
  5. install thunderbird on new pc, downloaded from thunderbird.net
  6. in receiving PC, click help>troubleshootinginformation
  7. scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'
  8. exit thunderbird
  9. now, paste contents of exported profile, overlaying contents of profile.
  10. if there is a compatibilitie.ini file, delete it
  11. restart thunderbird
creator: davidsk
